task.title: Task: Form with Chart
task.shortdesc: How to create a form with a chart..

context.p: In this task you are going to create a form with a column chart for 2010 showing the sales per box per month.

The various components in the graph can be extracted or calculated from certain tables. The BoxName is in table Boxes. The Sales must be calculated from the expression [Quantity]*[BoxPrice]. The field BoxPrice is also in table Boxes and the field Quantity is in table OrderDetails. The Month and Year can respectively be calculated with the functions Month([OrderDate]) and Year([OrderDate]).The field OrderDate is in table Orders. Furthermore grouping on BoxName and then on Month and filtering on year 2010.

You need to create a query which provide the necessary data ( BoxName, Sales, Month and Year). Grouping and filtering via the Total row in the design grid. For grouping you choose the option Group By and for filtering the option Where, with 2010 as value for Criteria.
The work consists of two parts. First, the query must be made and then the form with the chart.

step.cmd: Choose tab Create Query Design (group Queries) . Add the tables Boxes, OrderDetails and Orders.
Add field BoxName (table Boxes) and create the following calculated fields Month:Month([OrderDate]), Sales:[Quantity]*[BoxPrice] en Year:Year([OrderDate]).
Change in the column Sales the Group By operator in Sum and in the column Year in Where. Add 2010 as criteria for Year.

step.cmd: Close the query and save it with the name Sales per box per month in 2010.

note.p:
When you open the query again in Design View after closing it, Access has made some changes for the column Sales:
Value in row field is now Sales: Sum([Quantity]*[BoxPrice])
Value in row total is now Expression

step.cmd: Choose tab Create Form Wizard . Add table Boxes and from this table field BoxName. Click Next.
Answer the Wizard questions as follows:

ul.li: Title Sales per box per month in 2010.
Save the form with the same name as the title.

step.cmd: Open the form in Design View. Create some space for the chart in section Detail by dragging down the underside.
Choose tab Design Chart (group Controls and draw on the form a rectangular frame for the chart.
Answer the first three Wizard questions as follows:

ul.li: Use query Sales per box per month in 2010
Fields for the chart: Month and Sales.

stepresult.p: The Wizard displays a layout of the chart. You need to modify it.

step.cmd: Drag the field SumOfMonth out of the box at the vertical axis to the box at the horizontal axis. It is now displayed at the horizontal axis as Month.
Drag the field Sales to the box at the vertical axis. The display along the horizontal axis, then changes in SumOfSales.
Click Next. Enter for the title of the chart Sales per box per month in 2010 and choose not to display a legend. Then click Finish.

stepresult.note: The Design View shows an example graph and not the chart of real data.

step.cmd: Close the form and save the changes
Open the form and switch to Form View.
Browse through the records and after that close the form.
